alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 9:34PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cherry, northwestern Grant, northwestern Garden and southeastern Sheridan Counties through 1015 PM CDT/915 PM MDT/... At 933 PM CDT/833 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Medicine Lake to 15 miles north of Ashby to Antioch. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ellsworth, Medicine Lake, Ashby, Antioch, Speckel Meir Lake, Dipping Vat Meadow, Miles Lake, Herman Lake, Indian Hill, Sevenmile Hill, Watson Lake, Patterson Lake, Finnegan Lake, Schoolhouse Lake, Kincaid Lake, Kennedy Lake, Wild Horse Flats and Mother Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 7. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 141. Highway 61 between mile markers 161 and 194. Highway 97 between mile markers 93 and 97, and between mile markers 107 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for the Panhandle of, north central and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cherry; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry
